verses.plain: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.

tokens.t: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.

verses.plain: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.

tokens.t: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all
vanity.

verses.plain: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?

tokens.t: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?

verses.plain: One generation passeth away, and another generation cometh: but the earth abideth for ever.

tokens.t: generation passeth away, and
generation cometh: but the earth abideth for ever.

verses.plain: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.

tokens.t: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.

verses.plain: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.

tokens.t: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.

verses.plain: All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; unto the place from whence the rivers come, thither they return again.

tokens.t: All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea
not full; unto the place from whence the rivers come, thither they return again.

verses.plain: All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.

tokens.t: All things
full of labour; man cannot utter
the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.

verses.plain: The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.

tokens.t: The thing that hath been, it
which shall be; and that which is done
that which shall be done: and
no new
under the sun.

verses.plain: Is there any thing whereof it may be said, See, this is new? it hath been already of old time, which was before us.

tokens.t: Is there
thing whereof it may be said, See, this
new? it hath been already of old time, which was before us.

verses.plain: There is no remembrance of former things; neither shall there be any remembrance of things that are to come with those that shall come after.

tokens.t: no remembrance of former
neither shall there be
remembrance of
that are to come with
that shall come after.

verses.plain: ¶ I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

tokens.t: ¶ I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

verses.plain: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

tokens.t: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all
that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

verses.plain: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all is vanity and vexation of spirit.

tokens.t: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all
vanity and vexation of spirit.

verses.plain: That which is crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.

tokens.t: crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.

verses.plain: I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yea, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.

tokens.t: I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all
that have been before me in Jerusalem: yea, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.

verses.plain: And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.

tokens.t: And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.

verses.plain: For in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.

tokens.t: For in much wisdom
much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.

footnotes.text: to be…: or, to afflict them
that which is wanting: Heb. defect
